Micah or Micheas__06.1: Hear ye what the Lord saith: Arise, contend thou in judgment against <u>the mountains</u>, and let the hills hear thy voice.
Micah or Micheas__06.2: Let the mountains hear the judgment of the Lord, and the strong foundations of the earth: for the Lord will enter into judgment with his people, and he will plead against Israel.
Micah or Micheas__06.3: O my people, what have I done to thee, or in what have I molested thee? answer thou me.
Micah or Micheas__06.4: For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, and delivered thee out of the house of slaves: and I sent before thy face Moses, and Aaron, and Mary.
Micah or Micheas__06.5: O my people, remember, I pray thee, what Balach the king of Moab purposed: and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him, <u>from Setim to Galgal</u>, that thou mightest know the justices of the Lord.
Micah or Micheas__06.6: <u>What shall I offer</u> to the Lord that is worthy? wherewith shall I kneel before the high God? shall I offer holocausts unto him, and calves of a year old?
Micah or Micheas__06.7: May the Lord be appeased with thousands of rams, or with many thousands of fat he goats? shall I give my firstborn for my wickedness, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
Micah or Micheas__06.8: I will shew thee, O man, what is good, and what the Lord requireth of thee: Verily, to do judgment, and to love mercy, and to walk solicitous with thy God.
Micah or Micheas__06.9: The voice of the Lord crieth to the city, and salvation shall be to them that fear thy name: hear, O ye tribes, and who shall approve it?
Micah or Micheas__06.10: As yet there is a fire in the house of the wicked, the treasures of iniquity, and a scant measure <u>full of wrath</u>.
Micah or Micheas__06.11: Shall I justify wicked balances, and the deceitful weights of the bag?
Micah or Micheas__06.12: By which her rich men were filled with iniquity, and the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies, and their tongue was deceitful in their mouth.
Micah or Micheas__06.13: And I therefore began to strike thee with desolation for thy sins.
Micah or Micheas__06.14: Thou shalt eat, but shalt not be filled: and thy humiliation shall be in the midst of thee: and thou shalt take hold, but shalt not save: and those whom thou shalt save, I will give up to the sword.
Micah or Micheas__06.15: Thou shalt sow, but shalt not reap: thou shalt tread the olives, but shalt not be anointed with the oil: and the new wine, but shalt not drink the wine.
Micah or Micheas__06.16: For thou hast kept <u>the statutes of Amri</u>, and all the works of the house of Achab: and thou hast walked according to their wills, that I should make thee a desolation, and the inhabitants thereof a hissing, and you shall bear the reproach of my people.
